lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: I mean, I get it.

lines.speaker: Dr. London
lines.line: Get...?

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: You're a kid, and your whole life's ahead of you, and you have these notions... about what life is... and... what it could be. But eventually you have to let all that go. So that's what I'm... That's what I'm going to do... that's what I'm doing. Um, it's a part of growing up... You know, selling the comic-book collection and getting serious.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: And, honestly, they probably take anyone conscious for philosophy.

lines.speaker: Julia
lines.line: For philosophy, "conscious" is a detriment.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: Am I hallucinating?

lines.speaker: Eliot
lines.line: If you were, how would asking me help?

lines.speaker: Henry Fogg
lines.line: You want to go back to Columbia? That pointless, miasmic march to death you call life? Family that never calls and friends that don't really get you and feeling alone and wrong until it crushes you?

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: No.

lines.speaker: Henry Fogg
lines.line: Then quit dicking around!

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: Stop it.

lines.speaker: Henry Fogg
lines.line: Do some goddamn magic!

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: Um... okay... So, "Be a magician"? Is that illegal or...? Are you guys trying to take over the world or...?

lines.speaker: Henry
lines.line: This school exists for a single and timeless purpose—to reveal your innate abilities and hone them to the highest degree. Now, what you do with it after that is entirely up to you. If you want to take over the world, we don't teach that, but give it a go.

lines.speaker: Eliot
lines.line: We all signed this waiver. I hope you read yours. It says, "Spellwork is not unlikely to murder you, and, if so, oh, well."

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: And I really don't want to be the guy who dies in the first ten minutes of the movie because he's like, "You know what? Let's take out the Ouija board. What could possibly go wrong?"

lines.speaker: Pete
lines.line: You ask a lot of questions.

lines.speaker: Julia
lines.line: Yeah, I sure do.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: If you're trying to tell me that it gets better—

lines.speaker: Eliot
lines.line: Oh, God, no. No, it doesn't. I'm trying to tell you, you are not alone here. Funny little irony they don't tell you. Magic doesn't come from talent. It comes from pain.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: You don't even like me.

lines.speaker: Alice
lines.line: I don't know you.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: I don't know you either, except that we summoned some kind of killer mothman from another world.

lines.speaker: Alice
lines.line: Yeah, there is that.

lines.speaker: Julia
lines.line: Magic is real and that's the thing, and once you know that, you can't—

lines.speaker: Marina
lines.line: Nothing else matters.

lines.speaker: Julia
lines.line: Exactly. It's like... I know it's there. It's everywhere, all around me, a whole world of power and beauty. You can't unsee it. You wake up for the first time.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: Nobody would rather not know. You don't see color and want to go black and white.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: I go back there, and I'm... I'm a depressed super nerd.

lines.speaker: Eliot
lines.line: How about I find you, and I don't say magic is real, but I do seduce you, and so lift your spirits that life retains its sparkle for decades.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: Yeah, that sounds nice. Thank you.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: Is "Fillory" real?

lines.speaker: Jane
lines.line: Why even ask if you'll just forget it again?

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: The books, they're just—they always felt realer than anything.

lines.speaker: Jane
lines.line: Then it's real.

lines.speaker: Pete
lines.line: Just don't get too excited. Start slow.

lines.speaker: Julia
lines.line: Yeah, I don't really do slow.

lines.speaker: Pete
lines.line: Never gets old, does it? Having a secret. You have magic. They don't. Better than money. Better than sex.

lines.speaker: Pete
lines.line: Well, I guess that one depends.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: What's your discipline?

lines.speaker: Alice
lines.line: Phosphoromancy. I bend light.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: Holy shit!

lines.speaker: Alice
lines.line: There are much cooler areas.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: Are you kidding me? You have light bending power. I'm a nothing-mancer. I'm a squat-mancer.

lines.speaker: Quentin
lines.line: Phosphoromancy, bitches!

lines.speaker: Julia
lines.line: So how do you manage it all? Juggling magic and your life?

lines.speaker: Marina
lines.line: I don't understand the question.

lines.speaker: Marina
lines.line: I'm not judging you. I started out like you and you have a good life. Boyfriend. Probably think he keeps you centered. Right?

lines.speaker: Julia
lines.line: Kinda.

lines.speaker: Marina
lines.line: Or, you know, you're keeping him around in case you fail here and need to fall back.

lines.speaker: Marina
lines.line: All I know... you have to mean it for magic to work. Something clicks when you're all-in, and the real big stuff, you can't do it till you're doing it without a net.

lines.speaker: Margo
lines.line: Where you going, kitty cat?

lines.speaker: Alice
lines.line: I'm done here. For good. You should be happy. Less competition.

lines.speaker: Margo
lines.line: Alice. I like competition.
